column4: Transparent plastic storage box used as both the water reservoir and grow bed structure in the ebb and flow hydroponic system. The lid is modified to hold net pots.
Low-power submersible water pump used to periodically flood the grow bed and circulate nutrient solution in the system.
Flexible silicone tubing used to transport water between the pump, grow bed, and reservoir.
Foam inserts placed in net pots to hold seedlings securely while allowing roots to grow into the nutrient solution.
Microcontroller board used to control the pump timing, relay switching, and system logic.
Relay module used to safely switch the water pump on and off using control signals from the ESP32.
Small OLED display used to show system status, pump timing, and time remaining until the next flood cycle.
External power supply used to power the ESP32 and low-voltage electronics via USB.
Peat-based growing medium used for seed germination and early plant growth before roots reach the nutrient solution.
Plastic mesh pots used to hold plants in place while allowing roots to grow freely into the grow bed.
Liquid nutrient solution added to the reservoir to provide essential minerals for plant growth.
Optional USB camera intended for future use to capture periodic images and create plant growth timelapse videos.
Electrical jumper wires used to connect the ESP32 to the relay module, display, and other electronic components.
Inert growing medium used to support plants while allowing water flow and root aeration.
